channel.title: What does this mean?
channel.description:
Okay, well I downloaded the Xlinepk test client, and I went to run it and this message popped up. [code] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
Which, I have seen this message before, and I have always figured that there was something wrong with the client. So I asked the owner, Bluurr, what was causing this. He said that I needed 1.6.0, which I have, and then he said that I needed to install in, which I did like a month ago.
So, could someone tell me how to fix this error? [br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2007, 11:31:53 AM[/size][hr]Anyone?

item.title: What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @fozzy fozzy
item.description:
@fozzy wrote:

Okay, well I downloaded the Xlinepk test client, and I went to run it and this message popped up.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client
Press any key to continue . . .

Which, I have seen this message before, and I have always figured that there was something wrong with the client. So I asked the owner, Bluurr, what was causing this. He said that I needed 1.6.0, which I have, and then he said that I needed to install in, which I did like a month ago.

So, could someone tell me how to fix this error?
[br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2007, 11:31:53 AM[/size][hr]Anyone?
